column1: Lào Cai ([làːw kāːj] (listen)) is a city in the Northwest region of Vietnam. It is the capital of Lào Cai Province. The city borders the city of Hekou Yao Autonomous County
column2: in Yunnan province of southwest China. It lies at the junction of the Red River (Sông Hồng) and the Nanxi River (Yunnan) approximately 160 miles (260 km) northwest of Hanoi.It is a market town for timber
column3: and the Lào Cai Railway Station is located on the Hải Phòng railway to Yunnan Province in China.

column1: The town was invaded by China in 1979 and the border was closed until 1993. The town has a carbide factory. As of 2003 the district had a population of 86
column2: 855. The district covers an area of 223 km².Ethnic minorities in Lào Cai used to speak Southwestern Mandarin and Vietnamese to each other when their languages were not mutually intelligible.

column1: Lào Cai has a dry-winter humid subtropical climate (Köppen climate classification: Cwa)
column2: similar to most of Northern Vietnam.
